N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2002.4 - State budget director determination

State Regulations

Upon the written request of a municipality as set forth in
subdivision (c) of section
2002.3
of this Part, the
corporation shall: (a) Certify to the

State Director of the Budget that the estimated charge to be collected by the
corporation from the municipality is fair and reasonable in relation to the
estimated project cost, and that sufficient provisions exist in the agreement
to insure that the municipality shall at all times have sufficient moneys on
deposit with the corporation in advance of such charges pursuant to section
2002.5
of this Part. (b) Submit the estimated project budget, including fair and reasonable charges for the corporation's services, and the
proposed agreement to the State Director of the Budget for his determination
that the total estimated charge to be collected by the corporation from the
municipality is fair and reasonable in relation to the estimated total project
cost, and that sufficient provisions exist to ensure the collection of such
charge by the corporation from the municipality. (c) Any amendment to the agreement or any
other action which would affect any prior determination made by the State

Director of the Budget pursuant to subdivision (b) of this section shall be
resubmitted to the State Director of the Budget for his redetermination before
becoming effective. Notes
